attributes.action: make it unlawful for banks to demand a credit check when no credit has been applied for
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When applying for almost all banking products in the UK, banks and financial institutions as a matter of course demand that you authorise the bank to conduct a credit check. 

This has a detrimental effect on an individuals creditworthiness by diminishing their credit score, is only required by the bank to either sell additional products not requested by the applicant and/or to price for risk. 

Such a credit search should not be required at all for applicants who are not applying for credit products. 

The banks and financial institutions should be prohibited from requesting authorisation to conduct a credit check when a product contains no element of credit.
